oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Frances Lusky, 1976 July 21, excerpt 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Frances Lusky, conducted on 21 July 1976 by Leonard Wood as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Lusky discusses watching the sculptors, native Nashvillian Belle Kinney Scholz and her husband, Austrian Leopold Scholz, work on the second Parthenon replica. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lusky, Frances Blum, 1890-1980--Interviews; Scholz, Belle Kinney, 1890-1959; Scholz, Leopold F., 1877-1946
